abstract_summ: The recent emergence of a novel coronavirus (2019‐nCoV), which is causing an outbreak of unusual viral pneumonia in patients in Wuhan, a central city in China, is another warning of the risk of CoVs posed to public health.We find three main regions of unique sequence: two in the 1ab polyprotein QHO60603.1, one in surface glycoprotein QHO60594.1.Genus Aeromonas consists of facultative anaerobic, Gram negative Bacilli which are primary environmental inhabitants worldwide.Using a method for pathogen screening in DNA synthesis orders, we have identified a number of amino acid sequences that distinguish 2019-nCoV (Wuhan Coronavirus) from all other known viruses in Coronaviridae.This review will help understand the biology and potential risk of CoVs that exist in richness in wildlife such as bats.A recently reported strain of the genus, Aeromonas taiwanensis, was found while studying the presence of infectious marine microbes in a lacustrine wetland in India, making this the first isolation report from the country.
title_summ: Emerging coronaviruses: Genome structure, replication, and pathogenesisHighly Distinguished Amino Acid Sequences of 2019-nCoV (Wuhan Coronavirus)First report of isolation of Aeromonas taiwanensis from IndiaGenome Composition and Divergence of the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Originating in China
title_abstract_phrases: Emerging coronaviruses: Genome structure, replication, and pathogenesisThe recent emergence of a novel coronavirus (2019‐nCoV), which is causing an outbreak of unusual viral pneumonia in patients in Wuhan, a central city in China, is another warning of the risk of CoVs posed to public health.Highly Distinguished Amino Acid Sequences of 2019-nCoV (Wuhan Coronavirus)Using a method for pathogen screening in DNA synthesis orders, we have identified a number of amino acid sequences that distinguish 2019-nCoV (Wuhan Coronavirus) from all other known viruses in Coronaviridae.Genome Composition and Divergence of the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Originating in ChinaAn in-depth annotation of the newly discovered coronavirus (2019-nCoV) genome has revealed differences between 2019-nCoV and severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) or SARS-like coronaviruses.We find three main regions of unique sequence: two in the 1ab polyprotein QHO60603.1, one in surface glycoprotein QHO60594.1.First report of isolation of Aeromonas taiwanensis from IndiaGenus Aeromonas consists of facultative anaerobic, Gram negative Bacilli which are primary environmental inhabitants worldwide.This review will help understand the biology and potential risk of CoVs that exist in richness in wildlife such as bats.
